intro: Tardavel andongensis, commonly known as the Andong endemic plant, is a rare flowering species native to the mountainous regions of South Korea. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive silvery underside, while its flowers are small and white to pale green. Due to habitat loss, Tardavel andongensis is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
